Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.gui

Class GUI

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
it.polimi.ingsw.client.gui.GUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
UI, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.util.EventListener
public class GUI
extends javafx.application.Application
implements UI
The main GUI class. It starts the graphical user interface, mapping each scene to the specific phase. It's triggered when an event change is reported by the server, calling the correct components in order to make the local modification.
Author:
Luca Pirovano

    • setup

      public void setup()
      GUI setup method. It creates all the stage phase, which will be updated in another methods; in particular: - MENU: the game main menu, with Play and Quit buttons; - SETUP: small windows in which each player will insert his nickname and the server IP and port; - LOADER: the game loader, in which players will choose their color, god power and place their workers; - GUI: the effective game GUI (island board). Each stage scene is put inside an hashmap, which link their name to their fxml filename.

    • getStage

      public javafx.stage.Stage getStage()
      Returns:
      the actual stage configuration.

    • getObservers

      public java.beans.PropertyChangeSupport getObservers()
      Returns:
      the property change support listeners, that will be necessary to fire some changes to the correct GUI component.

    • centerApplication

      public void centerApplication()
      Center the application windows in the screen, relying on user's screen height and width, getting them from the Screen java class.

    • changeStage

      public void changeStage​(java.lang.String newScene)
      Change the stage scene, relying on the ones declared during setup phase. When this method is call, the actual stage scene is replaced from the parameter one.
      Parameters:
      newScene - the scene to be put live.

    • getConnection

      public ConnectionSocket getConnection()
      Returns:
      the connection to the server, which will be used to send messages or similar stuffs.

      Set the actual server connection
      Parameters:

    • getModelView

      public ModelView getModelView()
      Returns:
      the client ModelView, which contains information about the actual game state.

    • getControllerFromName

      public GUIController getControllerFromName​(java.lang.String name)
      Get a scene controller relying on his name, from the dedicated hashmap.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the controller to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      the correct controller.

    • errorHandling

      public void errorHandling​(GameError error)
      Handles the error received from the server, relying on their type.
      Parameters:
      error - the game error received from the server.

    • initialPhaseHandling

      public void initialPhaseHandling​(java.lang.String cmd)
      Handles the first game phase, which contains the nicknames choosing, the challenger phase and the workers placement.
      Parameters:
      cmd - the command answer received from the server.

    • customMessageHandling

      public void customMessageHandling​(java.lang.String msg)
      Handles all the custom message received from the server, making different things relying on their content.
      Parameters:
      msg - the custom message.

    • propertyChange

      public void propertyChange​(java.beans.PropertyChangeEvent evt)
      Listener's firing method; it handles all the changing reported from the server and makes things relying on their value.
      Specified by:
      propertyChange in interface java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
      Parameters:
      evt - the property change event fired from the component.
